reviews: I would highly recommend staying here, first class treatment! We were introduced to our room in a way I have only seen a couple of times when I had the pleasure of staying at a 5+ star hotel. The buffet breakfast that was included in our price was a much better than expected value. Service wasn't as attentive as could have been, but the immediately responded to any request. Great Downtown location the rooftop hotel overlooks the plaza. We will definitely stay here again and again!

This is a wonderful hotel, locations is perfect and service is formidable. Monica de La Rosa in charge of reservations with the help of  Mariana Reyes are always helpful and outstanding when booking. They do not miss a single detail no matter how small or big our group is. They are great at their job. I have no words to describe how marvelous this hotel is.

Have a meal or a drink here for the best views of Mexico City's main square. Ride the old world elevator all the way up, then go up two more stories. It all feels incredibly luxurious, but it is within reach of most tourists.

Marco Martinez Maldonado was an awesome server. He helped me with my Spanish and recommended local spots for us to check out. He was super attentive, kind, and patient. I highly recommend him and will revisit this restaurant because the service he gave was top notch. Would recommend—10/10!

We stated at the Gran Hotel Cuidad for 4 nights.  It was a great experience. The hotel is beautiful, and the location cannot be beat – right on Zocalo square.  The outdoor covered terrace on the rooftop overlooked Zocalo and was a wonderful location for breakfast and late-night drinks.  The staff was gracious, especially one of the door stewards, Victor.  They helped us line up things to do and made good suggestions for restaurants and shopping. And, of course, we also spent time trying to see where parts of the James Bond film were shot!   There was nothing we did not dislike.  We stayed in a junior suite.  It would have been nice to have more than one capsule of caffeinated coffee in the room (we did get more at the front desk).  A nightly turn-down would also have been nice

We stayed for 5 nights and it was truly a luxurious experience from beginning to end. For a couples getaway we highly recommend the zocalo view suite. It is spacious and elegantly decorated with historical style. We enjoyed  breakfast and most evening meals at the hotel, and can say only good things about the food, service, and atmosphere at the restaurant and throughout the hotel. We hope to come back soon!

I am typically not a luxury hotel traveller - I prefer Airbnbs and hostels. But Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico is the wonderful exception that proves the rule. I came for the stained glass ceiling. But they don't just cash in on the ceiling as a gimmick - throughout the entire stay, they make you feel like a million bucks (apologies to readers who are worth more than a million bucks). They give you champagne when you check in, and have a plate waiting in your room with treats and your name written in chocolate. I didn't know I needed that in my life, but I did.  The porters are helpful in all ways, and speak fluent English. Just be sure, when checking out, to give some time for them to retrieve your car from parking. It took a good 20 minutes for them to bring it down, which had us

Loved my stay at this hotel.  Truly an experience of old- world luxury with the most courteous and helpful staff I have encountered in my travels.    The building itself is significant to the history of Mexico City, and the hotel has been maintained to honor that history.  And everyone - from the bellboys to the front desk staff to the restaurant staff - is friendly, professional, and kind.  (I was traveling solo, stayed for only 4 nights, and at least 3 or 4 staff members greeted me by name by day 2.)  My stay included breakfast, and the Terraza is amazing.  It overlooks the Zocalo, and the food is top notch.  I’ve been told by my tour guides that locals frequently come here as well for a special meal.  Just a reminder, though, this is a historic hotel in the heart of the

From the time you arrive until you depart the customer service is exceptional.  Upon arrival a bellman carries your bags up to reception, then serves you champagne as you check in.  Everyone is helpful.  When we called to get anything taken care of, extra towels, help with the safe, they arrive promptly and courteously.  Beautiful architecture, Tiffany glass ceiling, art deco.  The location is next to Zocalo square.  Convienant to many sights and restaurants.  They also have a roof top restuarant, service was lovely.  True old fashion customer service.

We cannot express our wonderful experience with our dining experience at the La Terraza in the Gran Hotel Ciudad Mexico. The staff were very attentive at your every needs. In particular Alejandro was great. He attended to our anniversary dinner which made it very special. Alejandro also took photos of our which captured the moment just perfect. Being in Mexico we were not sure on our wine selection, we asked his recommendation and it turned out to be an excellent choice. Alejandro is the best. We highly recommend the hotel and restaurant.

This hotel was recommended to us by a friend who couldn't have said enough good things about it - and he was so correct! A luxurious hotel at a most reasonable price.  The staff were kind, courteous and helpful.  The hotel located on historic Zacola  Square is not only well situated, it offers an excellent panoramic view of the square.  The morning breakfast is voluminous with endless options.  The rooms are well appointed and most comfortable.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to visit Cuidad de Mexico.

The Hotel is on the edge of the Zocalo (Square) - the Plaza de la Constitución - at the Mexico City Historic centre.  It has a luxurious interior and is replete with old world features including an antique elevator as part of the decor.  The stained glass ceiling is famous.  The top floor with a further spiral stairway takes you to the Restaurant - the La Terraza - it includes an open terrace that looks directly down upon the City Zocalo.  All staff throughout the Hotel are very customer focused, always smiling and at your service.  It is well justified to leave a 100 peso gratuity on your bed each morning for the room attendants and a gratuity (or propina) of 10-15-20% for each restaurant meal's bill (la cuenta) is well received.  A short walk in any direction from the Hotel

Spectacular hotel in the heart of the city. Very reasonably priced and included a great buffet breakfast overlooking the main city square. Architecture and stained glass roof were awesome. Champagne when we arrived and great staff. Always bottled water on every floor. Steps away from amazing sites.

We had a very positive experience staying at the hotel.  The location is perfect, just off of the Zocalo and close to a number of sites.  We had an interior suite and it was fine - spacious and comfortable.  We included breakfast in our booking.  The breakfast buffet was very good, and worth including as it was expensive if you did not have it included with your room.

Excellent location, breakfast buffet at the rooftop restaurant  Super charming decor. Friendly staff Excellent View over the square the Zocalo, close to many things to see like the Cathedral, Diego’s wall paintings, Aztec ruins. Was casting location for James Bond movie Spectre 👍🏻

If you’re visiting Mexico City stay here. Great location and felt very safe. Rooms are lovely and even room 207 which was only a double was pretty big. My only gripe, you need to provide better quality and a bigger quantity of toiletries. For such a nice hotel you need to get that sorted out. Based in the historic centre so is in an excellent position 30 mins from airport.

Great place to stay right on the Zocalo.  (Not quiet but that should not be the expectation.)  Absolutely beautiful facility at a reasonable price with friendly and competent staff.  Air conditioning in our room didn't work and the restaurant in the building is not one of the better ones in the area.  But a great place to stay.

Marco y Edgar we're great at the brunch, at La Terraza, they were great servers and the food was amazing. Huge variety and a great view. The brunch includes mimosas and beer, it was so worth it. Thank you guys!

Excellent service by Diego and Maria and brunch was amazing.  The hotel was also amazing with historic elevators.  This is a must see in Mexico City.  We have been to other locations and this superseded our expectations.  We will return soon.

We stayed four nights in a wonderful room overlooking the square which comes alive with lights at night and you can also enjoy from the amazing terrace restaurant. So try the giant margaritas there! Food really delicious too. We did several day trips. When the one organised by the hotel wasn’t very good (city tour) the hotel couldn’t have been more apologetic, reimbursing from the tour operator and being so very helpful in all respects. The concierge is amazing here. And it’s such a thrill to know Spectre was filmed here. I much prefer this part of town too with its history and grandeur. The best hotel experience - Thank you! We’d love to come back.

Christopher and Freddy made our visit amazing!!! We came to celebrate our 20-year anniversary, and they  went above and beyond our expectations!!!!   The view was amazing! We were treated like family! This is a must do for anyone visiting and wants a great memory for your visit to Mexico City!

This is a mixed review.  The hotel staff and the facility were amazing.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Our only issue came with the restaurant upstairs.  The menu wasn't great and the service was pretty poor at times.  At one dinner, we were repeatedly ignored by wait staff.  I had to get up and get my wife a napkin and silverware, even after requesting it.  When we finally were served, our dinners were cold and my steak was nearly raw.  I couldn't eat it.  They did take the steak off the bill, however, and the waiter gave us a piece of cake and apologized for the poor service.  Overall, I would stay there, but look for other places to eat.

Glorious historic building with jaw dropping lobby. The rooms are big and perhaps a tad old fashioned in their furnishing but comfortable and spotlessly clean and everything works. You’re slap bang in the centre of el centro and as a tourist there’s no better place to stay. The restaurant La Terraza looks out over the Zocalo. The food is great and the views superb. Note that as a guest you do not need to reserve more than a few hours in advance - they keep tables for huéspedes. The team is professional and nothing is too much trouble. This really is a classy operation. In London or New York it would be five times the price. It’s a great choice. I can’t imagine staying anywhere else in CDMX.

Alfredo and Alejandro were so gentle with us, the place is awesome and beautiful architecture, food so tasty and clean; this is a great place to enjoy Mexican food and have a great view of El Zocalo in Mexico City.

We had an amazing stay at this hotel, a beautiful historical building that appeared in the Jame Bond movie "Spectre". Our room was perfectly comfortable and quiet. The location was right on the Zocalo in the historical center. We had drinks nearly every night at the terrace restaurant with an amazing view of the square. I read some comments that the area didn't feel safe at night. While it is true that it's deserted compared to daytime, we never felt unsafe. And the main pedestrianized street next to the hotel had plenty of people.  I also want to give special shout out to the breakfast. It is literally the most delicious and plentiful buffet I've ever had (and this is in comparison with some of the outrageous breakfast buffet in Asian countries). There's made-to-order eggs with

The location is excellent if you are an art lover, else, no entertainment or good restaurants around.the room was comfortable. The hotel is lifeless, and about the terrasse restaurant , don’t bother going for a late dinner, we got kicked out at 11 pm sharp , being told we could take the drink in our room and they closed the curtain by our table to block the view… a disgrace!

The Gran Hotel is first of all, absolutely stunning and a must visit even if you don't stay there. We stayed there three nights and had an amazing experience. We booked a junior suite looking out to the Zocalo and got upgraded to a master suite. It was giant and the view was spectacular (go to the Terazza for a similar view!), though if you have the bad luck of running into a demonstration on the square like we did, it can be very loud. However the gracious staff gave us a key to an interior room on the night it was loud. We ended up not needing it since it quieted down before our bedtime but the gesture was extremely appreciated. I was also impressed with the security during the event.   I definitely want to mention the breakfast buffet which was included in our rate and quite

Great service and Marcelo and Marcos were attentive to our needs. I enjoyed the drinks and everything went smooth. The view was great and we definitely enjoyed vegan options and the mojitos were great

This hotel is NOT DISABILITY FRIENDLY.  If you are disabled you need to enter through a side alley and step on a small steel platform that moves you up like a small fenicula.  It is not very safe.  And you feel like a slab of meat.  The ONLY restaurant available for guests was on the rooftop which required you to climb a long, winding staircase.  This winding staircase might as well have been Mt Everest for my 91 year old father.   He would never make that climb.   My father uses a walker or wheelchair.   It states on the website there are 2 restaurants.  The other restaurant was on the main floor and was closed.   My father could’ve used this restaurant if it was open.  They would not open it for my elderly, disabled father.   They said, “ you could order room service.”

Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Gran Hotel, CDMX. I must say the hotel exceeded my high expectations from the beginning. From the welcome champagne glass at check in to the attention to every detail during your stay. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly, providing top level service. The room was a master suit which the family and I enjoyed immensely. The Terraza roof top restaurant was a great place for lunch and dinner over looking the Zocalo. Staying in the historic center provides a great opportunity to explore the surroundings. The area is extremely safe and well policed. For the best tacos in the area go to los cocuyos about 5 blocks away. We highly recommend staying at The Gran Hotel and plan to return in the near future. Thanks.

Amazing experience! We absolutely loved staying here! Each person who works here loves what they do and are so kind and sweet. We especially loved the lady in the front desk, Vivian. She went above and beyond, always smiling and making the entire experience phenomenal! The uniforms for the bell boys and the cleaning staff were incredible! The restaurant was wonderful with its breath taking view and delicious assortment of food and drinks!

Best view of the historic city center in Mexico City. Christopher and Marcelo provided perfect service. We tried our best at Spanglish but they were very accommodating. The food was 10/10 and the margaritas are awesome. The “dunch” is about $41USD PP and includes unlimited food; including tacos, omelettes, and quesadillas fresh to order, along with a standard buffet of Mexican food, desserts and pastries. Margaritas, beer and mimosas are also unlimited and included. highly recommend!

This hotel greatly exceeded my expectations!! The staff was amazing the property is immaculate and right in the city center.  There is so much to do right outside the door, but I highly recommend coordinating transportation with the hotel.  We were given Christian and Jose Manuel who were awesome and took use all over the city to all the touristy hot spots.  Traffic is crazy so it was nice to have someone that knew where to go and its very affordable.  We cannot wait to get back!!

1st time in Mexico City 🇲🇽 and "Terraza" Restaurant on the roof top is a definite must! Our waiter Marcos went above and beyond to make sure we were well served and his menu suggestions made our choices easy and received exactly what we were craving. Muchas gracias Marcos por su servicio el dia de celebrar el cumple de mi amigo. Espero poder verlos a todos muy pronto la proxima vez que regrese a cuidad de México

As a traveler, I have stayed in many hotels over the years, but my recent stay at the Gran Hotel Ciudad de México truly exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I arrived, I felt welcomed and at home, thanks to the outstanding service provided by the hotel staff.  The rooms were spacious and immaculately clean, with all the amenities one would expect from a luxury hotel. The bed was comfortable, and the linens were soft and cozy, making it easy for me to relax and get a good night's sleep after a long day of sightseeing.  The food at the hotel's restaurant was exceptional. The chefs clearly take great pride in their work, as each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavour. I particularly enjoyed the local specialties, which were a great way to experience the

This was a fantastic hotel in a beautiful city  I recently visited from the UK with my 2 adult children  - the staff at reception and very especially in the restaurant ( Marcelo Alex Maria) were so helpful at all times, great service from everyone too numerous to numerous to mention also  the buffet breakfast was literally fabulous! unmissable  I can’t recommend this hotel in a perfect location to explore beautiful Mexico City highly enough!

Lovely hotel located next to the zocalo. Best rooms are facing the square. Very friendly and attentive staff. Was great to have Flavio drive us to the airport. Car was clean and very smooth ride. Lots of great restaurants and shops close by. Close to the fabulous Rivera murals in the Palacio, the wonderful Templo Mayor and the impressive cathedral. Don’t miss el Cardenal for breakfast. Be aware it is noisy most of the time but gets quiet around 10 pm. Lots of people all the time

Restaurant Terraza- We had dinner at this restaurant. The place is beautiful, great setting. The interrior of the hotel is impressive. I would recommend it for a romantic date. Omar and Cesar gave us great service.

I went on a vacation with my 81 year old mom who is very strong but requires special care, and booked our accommodations at Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico after hearing glowing reviews. I was hoping for the best, and to say that it exceeded our expectations is a massive understatement. We were ecstatically happy staying at this gorgeous, sweet jewel from the first joyful moment we arrived to the bittersweet moment we left. It is THE PLACE to stay in Mexico City!!!!!!!!  Not only is the hotel outrageously beautiful, it is astoundingly affordable, and the staff is warm, sincere, gracious, A+ professional, knowledgeable, thoughtful, hardworking, above and beyond first class.  All of the concierges (but Cynthia most especially) were attentive, efficient, amazing and lovely, and all of

The moment we walked in the door we were met by the bellman who took our luggage and waited as we checked in. We were brought a glass of champagne to refresh ourselves. On the way to our room, he gave us the history of the Gran Hotel while we rode the beautiful elevator viewing the breathtaking Tiffany ceiling and arches that sinished landed outside our room.  Our room had a view of the street. The room was spacious and everything you'd expect from a 5-star hotel. The Terraza Restaurant was beautiful with a view of the Zocalo. Food was delicious and has the omelet area. Bed was very comfortable. Service was immaculate. Staff were friendly and oh so helpful. If they saw you standing around, they'd ask if they could help in any way. If you need Uber to get around, they pick you us

The restaurant Terraza at the Gran Hotel  in Mexico City is a great place for any meal. We were staying at the Gran Hotel and went there several times. The quality of the food was outstanding and consistent. The view of the Zócalo was the best in the city. It was amazing. The service was superb.  Christopher Arteaga, and his partner Humberto were great. They went above and beyond to make our visits very pleasant and enjoyable. We certainly recommend this restaurant highly. The food, the ambiance the view, and the outstanding service make La Terraza a great place for any meal.

Went to the Gran Hotel de Ciudad for breakfast on a trip with my daughter. A very lovely concierge booked us into breakfast and took us up to the room in the old ‘30s style elevator. She also gave us a bit of history about the amazing stained glass roof in the main atrium. When we got to our breakfast table, we had a great view of the Plaza de la Constitucion and  Catedral Metropolitan at Zocalo. The service provided by David Coronado was fantastic. The staff couldn’t do enough for us and the food was excellent. Thoroughly recommend having breakfast here even if you’re not staying in the hotel. Great start to a day in Mexico City.

I would like to said thank you very much to the next wonderful people who are working in this very beautiful hotel Jose Luis,Rosa,Daniela,Viviana,Diego,Francisco,Uriel,Victor and Cynthia .these great employees all the time give me a excellent FIVE STARS SERVICE on all aspects.I would like to recommend this incredible property,if you want to be treated like a kind this is the right place.Thank you very much and I ll comeback.Raul from San Francisco CA USA.:)

I'm a huge art nouveau fan, so visiting this hotel and it's famous Tiffany stained glass ceiling was high on my list. We went intending to enjoy the glass, and probably get dinner as well at 6pm. The lobby had a very strange layout, I must say, and had a non-welcoming vibe and design overall. They had a worker repairing some ramp elevator at the entrance with a metal grinder making an incredible cacophany for over 20 minutes...a strange choice of timing as people were arriving for dinner. The restaurant was difficult to locate, and when I asked to see a menu, I was referred to one of those obnoxious scannable menu links - not something I'd expect at an upscale place.   The lobby was very sparsely decorated, was overly bright, and seems that nobody with interior design sense was

My experience at the restaurant/terrace was absolutely fantastic! Jorge, our waiter, provided exceptional recommendations that truly enhanced my visit to Mexico City. The friendly staff and the exquisite beauty of the hotel itself made the experience even more memorable. The captivating stained glass ceilings added a touch of enchantment that left me in awe. This is definitely a place you don't want to miss! 5 *

Christopher & Rodolfo, help us a lot. The service is great from the start. The included breakfast is a buffet with many options going from traditional Mexican food to classic American breakfast. Omelette's and other items were made on the spot and drinks were delivered to our table as requested. The view is amazing and overall a good experience.

We just got back from Mexico City and had the most fabulous time, starting with our check-in at the Gran Hotel.  As always, they made our stay nothing short of delightful.  Everyone we encountered during our stay was the epitome of pleasant and professional.  Our room was sublimely cleaned each day upon our return.  Every request made at the front desk was taken care of toot sweet and with flawless precision.  In short, we had a wonderful four night visit to this magnificent city and the groundwork was laid at the Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico.  We'd like to throw shout outs to everyone at there but only learned a couple of names in particular, Francisco and Diego, resplendent and delightful in their quasi-Beefeater uniforms.  Everyone related to this fine establishment deserves a

A beautiful hotel above every expectation. The service is sublime, everything from champagne at checkin to the fine greatings on the terrass. The room was above 5+. Absolut topnotch at everything. (Including breakfast, brunch, dinner and gym)

Christopher Arteaga and Marcelo served us as we enjoyed the beautiful views on the Terraza rooftop restaurant. Mezcal margaritas were fruity and refreshing. The food was delicious as well. Fanciest agua chiles I’ve ever had. We also had the cochinita, definitely recommend.

We loved our stay here and despite the one negative cannot fault this hotel. The location is amazing and the breakfast buffet is fantastic for the view over the square and the choice of food. The green juices were amazing! The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was comfortable and large, we loved the old colonial feel of the hotel. The one negative - there was a constant fan noise (we think) we could hear from the room (note its not double glazed) so be aware if you book a room with two double beds on the third floor. This was the only noise we heard and ear plugs helped.  For the location you are only 20mins from the airport and as Mexico City is a very big city with lots of traffic  this was another plus.  Overall a great stay in an amazing hotel, recommended.
